newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: UTC/BHG sell Jelmoli stake to Fust.
newsitem.headline: UTC/BHG sell Jelmoli stake to Fust.

text.p: Basler Handelsgesellschaft AG (BHG) and trading company UTC International AG said on Monday they had decided to sell their stake in Swiss retailer Jelmoli Holding AB to Walter Fust for around 270 million Swiss francs.

The sale represents a premium of more than 30 percent above the share price last quoted, they said. BHG/UTC said the sale would also allow them to fulfill all their bank obligations and also raise money that can be used to further expand international activities.
A statement from UTC, a unit of BHG, said the decision to sell the Jelmoli stake was taken on July 12.
Walter Fust is a minority shareholder in Jelmoli after Jelmoli acquired a majority of Fust in 1994.
The sale means that Jelmoli president Peter Gloor, vice president Gaudenz Staehelin and Conrad Schwyzer will step down from Jelmoli Holding's board of directors and also Jelmoli AG.
A separate statement from Fust said a news conference about the transaction would be held on Monday at 1000 GMT in Zurich.
